title: Epithelial-mesenchymal transition—a hallmark of breast cancer metastasis
publication_info: Y Wang, BP Zhou - Cancer hallmarks, 2013 - ingentaconnect.com
snippet:
Epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) is a highly conserved cellular program that converts 
polarized, immotile epithelial cells to migratory mesenchymal cells. in addition, emt was 
initially recognized as a key step for morphogenesis during embryonic development. emerging …

title: Bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells
publication_info: KC Kemp, J Hows, C Donaldson - Leukemia & lymphoma, 2005 - Taylor & Francis
snippet:

title: Potential of mesenchymal stem cell therapy
publication_info: F Dazzi, NJ Horwood - Current opinion in oncology, 2007 - journals.lww.com
snippet:

title: Immunosuppression by mesenchymal stromal cells: from culture to clinic
publication_info: BJ Jones, SJ McTaggart - Experimental hematology, 2008 - Elsevier
snippet:

title: Immunomodulatory properties of mesenchymal stem cells and their therapeutic applications
publication_info: TG Yi, SU Song - Archives of pharmacal research, 2012 - Springer
snippet:
Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) are adult stem cells that can be isolated from most adult 
tissues, including bone marrow, adipose, liver, amniotic fluid, lung, skeletal muscle and 
kidney. The term MSC is currently being used to represent both mesenchymal stem cells and …

title: The role of mesenchymal stem cells in maintenance and repair of bone
publication_info: R Bielby, E Jones, D McGonagle - Injury, 2007 - Elsevier
snippet:

(osteoblast) and bone resorbing (osteoclast) cells. Although skeletal turnover continues …
